text:
About data migration. We are moving from one portal to another. Ideally, all data would be transferred to a new HubSpot portal (including timeline activity and form submission analytics). What migration tool do you recommend? What limits do you know?

This is like replicating the portal to another region.

Hi folks,

does anyone knows how to check visitor response contains space (" ")  in the HubSpot chat conversation flow.?

I tried this condition in the if/then condition  (" "), but it does not work. please share your response here if anyone has an idea..

Note: I am checking the contact's full name as the response  (first name and last name) for calendar booking...
Hi, should CSS always minify when loaded in theme template like this {{ require_css(get_asset_url(‘../../css/main.css’)) }} Any ideas how to debug?
ups sorry, i meant, HubSpot is not combining individual CSS files into one file.
yes i’m aware of that, on that file however it’s including other partials. However as far as i understand it should minify it.
Tried to google this, and somewhere it was mentioned that if there was any syntax errors e.g. empty variables it would not minify. Just wondering what would be the best way to debug this
Ok got it fixed, just hope there would be some sort of error log from HubSpot side to make it easier debug…
Just some syntax errors in one of the css files it was including in the main.css

So i just created a new css file and included everything that was included in main css one by one, to see which one broke the minification Took while but was able to spot where the problem was quite fast.
it was almost released as a beta, but the announcement was pulled, my guess is it moved to private beta and those accounts have access
That would absolutely explain it!! I was starting to doubt my grasp on reality there for a second.

Finally had a chance to find the thread, it's in private beta and you can opt in via <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Drag-amp-Drop-functionality-for-Blog-Posts/idi-p/408909|this idea in the HS community>.
